Bitcoin Buzz Into Barbie Film
Although Robbie has seldom shared her views on cryptocurrency publicly, Mattel, the parent company of Barbie, has displayed longstanding support for blockchain technology as an emerging revenue stream for its brands.¬†
In recent years, the company has explored the utilization of blockchain for creating digital collectibles and other products.

entry.title: Robert Kiyosaki Warns US Economy Not Strong, America Broke ‚Äî Says He Still Prefers Bitcoin
entry.summary:
Rich Dad Poor Dad author Robert Kiyosaki says the U.S. economy is not strong and America is broke. Noting that the stock market is going up because President Joe Biden raised the debt ceiling, he emphasized that he still prefers gold, silver, and bitcoin.
Robert Kiyosaki‚Äôs Latest Economic Warnings
The author of Rich Dad Poor Dad, Robert Kiyosaki, is back with more warnings about the U.S. economy. Rich Dad Poor Dad is a 1997 book co-authored by Kiyosaki and Sharon Lechter. It has been on the New York Times Best Seller List for over six years. More than 32 million copies of the book have been sold in over 51 languages across more than 109 countries.
Kiyosaki slammed the Wall Street Journal in a tweet on Sunday for claiming that the U.S. economy is strong. He explained that the stock ma‚Ä¶

Mt. Gox Former CEO Breaks Silence, Delivers Important Message To Creditors
entry.summary:
The Mt. Gox scandal remains one of the most significant events in the history of cryptocurrency. In 2014, the exchange suffered a major hack, resulting in the theft of over 850,000 Bitcoin (BTC), worth approximately $450 million.
Since then, the hunt for the stolen Bitcoin has continued. In 2019, a group of creditors filed a civil rehabilitation petition to recover their lost funds. The trustee in charge of the Mt. Gox estate, Nobuaki Kobayashi, has been selling off the exchange‚Äôs remaining assets to repay the creditors.¬†
Recently, Australian entrepreneur and self-proclaimed Bitcoin creator, Craig Wright, claimed ownership of the 1Feex address, which has been linked to the Mt. Gox hack. Wright‚Äôs claims have raised questions since the 1Feex address received a significant amount of Bitco‚Ä¶

entry.title: Regulators Tell Nigerians To Stay Away From Binance, Here‚Äôs Why
entry.summary:
Nigeria‚Äôs Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has warned Nigerians against investing or trading on Binance, the world‚Äôs largest crypto exchange by trading volume. The Commission, as part of its ‚Äústatutory mandate of investor protection,‚Äù warned local investors of the risk of trading in crypto assets, tagging it as a ‚Äúhigh level of risk‚Äù which may result in total loss of investments.
Crypto Exchange‚Äôs Operations Tagged As ‚ÄúIllegal‚Äù
According to the circular released by the Commission on July 28, it stated that the operations of Binnace in the country are illegal as the company is neither registered nor regulated by the Commission.¬†
The circular read:
The Commission again reiterates that the activities of Binance, https://www.binance.com and any such other platform through wh‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ron DeSantis Vows to End Biden‚Äôs War on Bitcoin and Cryptocurrency as US President
entry.summary:
Florida Governor and U.S. presidential candidate Ron DeSantis has promised to end Joe Biden‚Äôs war on bitcoin and cryptocurrency if he is elected president of the United States. In addition, he stressed that on his first day as president, ‚ÄúCBDC goes into the trash can. We‚Äôre not going to allow it.‚Äù
Ron DeSantis‚Äô Promises on Bitcoin, Crypto, Central Bank Digital Currency
Florida Governor and U.S. presidential candidate Ron DeSantis made several promises regarding bitcoin and cryptocurrency during his speech Monday at a campaign rally in New Hampshire.
‚ÄúWe are going to let Americans invest in things like bitcoin and cryptocurrency. No one‚Äôs forcing you to do it. If you want to do it you can do it,‚Äù DeSantis emphasized, adding:
Biden‚Äôs war on bitcoin and cryptocurrency will come to an end when I become president.
DeSantis also reiterated his promise to stop the Fed from launching a central bank digital currency (CBDC). ‚ÄúWe also will reject the Federal Reserve‚Äôs attempt to impose a central bank digital currency on the American people,‚Äù the presidential hopeful emphasized, elaborating:
As president, on day one, CBDC goes into the trash can. We‚Äôre not going to allow it.
Noting that the Fed wants to ‚Äúgo to a cashless society,‚Äù DeSantis opined: ‚ÄúThey want to eliminate cryptocurrency and they want all the transactions to go through this central bank digital currency.‚Äù He noted that he recently signed legislation in Florida where ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt recognize central bank digital currency.‚Äù The Florida governor has repeatedly said that ‚ÄúCBDC is a massive threat to American liberty.‚Äù
DeSantis has also promised to protect the right to use bitcoin. He said in May: ‚ÄúYou have every right to do bitcoin, the only reason bureaucrats in DC don‚Äôt like bitcoin is that they can‚Äôt control it. As president, we‚Äôll protect your right to use bitcoin.‚Äù
What do you think about Florida Governor Ron DeSantis‚Äô promises regarding bitcoin, crypto, and CBDC? Let us know in the comments section below.

entry.title: IRS Classifies Crypto Staking Rewards As Taxable Income Upon Receipt
entry.summary:
The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) has recently issued a ruling stating that United States cryptocurrency investors who receive rewards from staking services are required to include the value of those rewards in their gross income.
On July 31, 2023, the IRS issued Revenue Ruling 2023-14, providing clarity on the tax implications for individuals engaging in staking activities. Income realized in any form, such as money, property, services, or staking rewards, is considered part of the gross income.
According to the recent Revenue Ruling 2023-14 by the IRS, this definition encompasses various sources of earnings for tax purposes. Therefore, taxpayers must include any income obtained from staking digital assets on proof-of-stake (PoS) blockchains as part of their annual income.
Related ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Hard-Hitting New York Attorney Files To Join Ripple Lawsuit Against SEC
entry.summary:
High-powered attorney Douglas Samuel Zolkind has officially filed a motion to intervene in the SEC‚Äôs lawsuit against Ripple Labs. As Ripple Labs continues in its legal battle against the SEC, the New York-based attorney has indicated his intention to appear on behalf of the blockchain payments company.¬†
The Persistent Legal Tussle Between Ripple And The SEC
Ripple Labs‚Äô legal tussle with the SEC has shaken the crypto industry for the past few years. The regulator filed a lawsuit against Ripple Labs in December 2020, alleging that Ripple had conducted an unregistered securities offering worth over $1.3 billion through the sale of XRP.¬†
The lawsuit seems to be calming down, as Ripple Labs recently secured partial victory in court. But despite the partial victory, many believe the fig‚Ä¶

entry.title: By The Numbers: What Percentage Of Uniswap Traders Are Bots?
entry.summary:
Data from Glassnode has revealed what percentage of traders on Uniswap are bots, and what percentage are humans. Here are the exact numbers.
The Dominance Of Each Trader Type On The Uniswap DEX
In its latest weekly report, the on-chain analytics firm Glassnode has looked into the various underlying metrics related to Uniswap. One of the interesting findings of the report includes the distribution of the platform‚Äôs trading activity among the different trader types.
More specifically, the analytics firm has separated the DEX‚Äôs trading volume (that is, the total amount of tokens being moved around on the platform) for humans and bots.
The bots here refer to automated programs that watch the blockchain to find lucrative trades and execute them. There are various types of these bots, bu‚Ä¶

entry.title: German Data Watchdog Investigates Worldcoin Amid Ongoing Issues
entry.summary:
Sam Altman‚Äôs brainchild, Worldcoin (WLD), is facing scrutiny as the Bavarian state regulator in Germany has been actively investigating the project for a full year.
According to Michael Will, the President of the Bavarian State Office for Data Protection Supervision, the regulator has expressed apprehensions regarding WLD‚Äôs ambition to handle ‚Äúsensitive data on a very large scale.‚Äù
Will stated that the German watchdog is spearheading the investigation into Worldcoin‚Äôs data collection and storage procedures. This inquiry falls under the purview of European data protection rules due to the presence of a subsidiary of Tools for Humanity, the company responsible for the project, in Germany.
Related Reading: Worldcoin and XRP are Crashing, While DOGE, WSM, and BTC20 Continue to Surge
Th‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Mining in July: $844.56 Million in Revenue, Dominance of Top Pools, and Fluctuating Difficulty Levels
entry.summary:
As per the data compiled for the month of July, bitcoin miners discovered a total of 4,366 blocks, collectively accruing approximately $844.56 million in block rewards and fees. This figure marks an estimated increase of $60.8 million from the previous month.
July‚Äôs Bitcoin Mining Landscape: Top Pools Capture 65.65% of Global Hashrate
On July 31, 2023, the Bitcoin hashrate was smoothly navigating at a rate of 386.89 exahash per second (EH/s), with the past 2,016 blocks reflecting an average of approximately 377.7 EH/s. The month of July was marked by two pivotal difficulty retargets: the first of these adjustments occurred on July 11, increasing by 6.45% and elevating the total to 53.91 trillion.
Then, roughly two weeks later on July 26, or precisely 2,016 blocks subsequent to the pr‚Ä¶

entry.title: 'Big Respect Between Ethereum and Cosmos Developer Communities': dYdX Foundation CEO
entry.summary: CEO of the dYdX Foundation Charles d'Haussy unpacks the decision behind moving one of the largest decentralized exchange protocol's over to its very own chain built on Cosmos. A key driver, he told Decrypt at this year's EthCC event, was that instead of launching on a rollup or another layer-1, launching a fully customized chain will allow dYdX to fine tune the network for its product's needs.

entry.title: Ethereum Staking Solution Lido 'Had Perfect Product Market Fit' at Launch, Says DAO's Biz Dev Contributor
entry.summary: Marin Tvrdiƒá, a business development contributor to the Lido DAO, sat down with Decrypt during this year's EthCC to break down how the liquid staking protocol has managed such a massive lead, how it plans to keep that lead, and the protocol's new dual-governance tokenomics.

entry.title: What's Going to Stop All the DeFi Hacks? 'Standards,' Says OpenZepplin Security Architect
entry.summary: OpenZeppelin's security solutions architect Michael Lewellen sat down with Decrypt to discuss how the industry can become a little safer for users at this year's EthCC Paris. The key? Introducing security standards across the industry so folks know what an audit actually means and where risks lie, be it bad faith actors or poor implementation.

entry.title: 'Ev.io' Game Review: Earn Solana While Blasting Enemies
entry.summary: Ev.io is a web-based first-person shooter that's free to play, but lets NFT holders earn in-game currency that can be redeemed for Solana (SOL). Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin shares his review of the fun throwback to Quake-style blasting, albeit with a modern crypto twist.

entry.title: 'Moving Fast and Breaking Things Isn't the Web3 Ethos': MetaMask Product Lead
entry.summary: Account abstraction this, smart wallets that. Discussions at EthCC Paris about improving user experience have pointed at industry leader MetaMask as an example of what not to do. But that may soon change, with a host of updates and optimizations coming to crypto's number one wallet, said its product lead Alex Jupiter. It still may take some time, though, before these changes take effect.

entry.title: Scaling Smart Wallets on Starknet 'Was The Winning Combination', Says Argent Co-Founder
entry.summary: Argent co-founder Julien Niset told Decrypt at EthCC Paris that he wants to make crypto wallets disappear. Or at least how they're currently conceived. From clunky seed phrases to a stiff user experience, Argent hopes to make using crypto a little less intimidating and a whole lot more fun.

entry.title: Inside Mighty Action Heroes' Open Beta
entry.summary: Mighty Action Heroes is the flagship blockchain title from Mighty Bear Games. But is the browser-based battle royale shooter worth checking out? Decrypt's Kate Irwin offers her thoughts and a first look at the upcoming game.

entry.title: Dr. Disrespect's 'Deadrop': Early Access Gameplay From Snapshot VI

Currently, Deadrop offers Polygon Founders Pass NFTs with no other crypto plans revealed just yet.

entry.title: 'More and More' Game Publishers Will Embrace NFTs: Mythical Games CEO
entry.summary: In the wake of EA Sports and Fortnite creator Epic Games embracing Nike's NFT platform, Mythical Games CEO John Linden tells Decrypt's Andrew Hayward how quickly he expects to see more major traditional game publishers enter the blockchain space and how quickly the industry will scale.

entry.title: Gran Saga Unlimited Early Access: Inside the Anime MMORPG on Aptos
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin plays Gran Saga: Unlimited's second community playtest, reports her findings, and offers her opinion and insights on the upcoming game, which will offer optional Aptos NFTs.

entry.title: 100 Thieves' Moe Says Blockchain Games Will 'Eventually' Be Accepted by Livestreamers
entry.summary: 100 Thieves content creator and gamer Moe also goes by "Yassuo" online after his favorite League of Legends character. Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks him about 100 Thieves' future crypto plans and whether Moe thinks creators like xQc and Pokimane might ever come around to blockchain games.

entry.title: "Games of the Future Are Going to Be Different," Says Splinterlands Cofounder
entry.summary: Splinterlands Cofounder Matt Rosen tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how the game has evolved over its five-year history and why he doesn't listen to the FUD around crypto.

entry.title: Inside Champions Ascension: Like 'For Honor' with NFTs?
entry.summary: Plai Labs Marketing Director Payton Kaleiwahea tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about player response to the combat game Champions Ascension in development, which offers arena combat, raid bosses, AI landscape features, and more.

entry.title: Ex-Activision VP Michael Lee: Gaming Is Crypto's 'Killer App'
entry.summary: Former Activision Vice President Michael Lee is now the SVP of Growth at Matter Labs. At the 3XP gaming conference, Lee sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss crypto gaming and give his predictions for the industry.

entry.title: Behind the Scenes with AMGI Studios and My Pet Hooligan
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes to Burbank, California for a behind-the-scenes tour of AMGI Studios, the developers of upcoming game My Pet Hooligan.
